item.title: Takeaways from Deep Work by Cal Newport
item.description: “Deep Work” is a book by Cal Newport, a computer science professor at Georgetown University. This book focuses mostly on pushing your cognitive abilities to their limit and producing work that is difficult to replicate. Some examples of what could be considered as deep work : Working on solving some problems that are crucial for your work Learning new skills Reading a book about how to perform well professionally But these should be performed in an environment with uninterrupted distractions.

item.title: A Better Way of Reading Books
item.description: The ideas that I am sharing in this article are confined to non-fiction books. Media is filled with stories about how many books successful people read in a year on average. Bill gates reads 100 books in a year. Elon musk used to read 2 books a day ( > 600 books in a year). Mark Zuckerberg aimed to read one book every 2 weeks (26 books in a year).
